page.title: 03INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: As a small boy in the early 1920's a group of Serbian gypsies camped on Kingswood Common, having travelled all over Europe. One day they all came into the village, swarthy men with dark bewhiskered faces,the women with bright dresses, accompanied by their native horses and dogs. They entertained the village, with their dancing bears, and monkeys on barrels or cans,the gypsies performed their native dances. Albrighton was also well known for its May day fair, special trains being run from the Black Country and many horse drawn vehicles coming by road. There were no street lights. The railway station was very busy. Being the centre for despatching sugar beet to Alscott factory and timber to wolverhamton. An interview with Mr.V.Stroudley,age 69.
